Description: Up for auction is this Epiphone SG G-400. This guitar has the full Batwing pickguard. This guitar is a 2007 model made in the Unsung China factory. The previous owner wired the pickups in reverse. The soddering work could possibly need to be redone. The sound from the the middle position and the neck position sometimes sounds weak but the sound will kick in. An additional switch was added I'm thinking that the previous owner wanted to wire the guitar to be able to split the coils or for a kill switch. I took a photo of the control cavity so the wiring can be seen. The new owner can setup the guitar to their preference. This guitar is good for someone who knows how to tinker. The one major flaw is that the guitar was cracked at one time on the bottom of the body where the control cavity side is. I tried to capture the most obvious damage. The previous owner did a pretty good job of gluing the guitar back together. It feels solid. The guitar does have some scratches on the back of the guitar too. I will only ship to the Continental United States. Please take the time to check out my other listed guitars. I mistakenly thought this guitar was made in the Unsung Factory in Korea, because the serial number starts with a "U." I researched further and the fact that the serial number starts with "UC" is supposed to signify the guitar was made in the Unsung China factory.
Title: 2007 Epiphone G400 SG
